metadata.feature_description: Tests the extension point for future account settings features

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Evoq.Accounts menu item exists in PersonaBar

steps.action: Navigate to the website and log in as superuser
steps.expected: PersonaBar should be visible with menu items
steps.actual: Successfully logged in and PersonaBar is visible with all menu items including the Evoq.Accounts item

steps.action: Verify the Evoq.Accounts menu item exists in the PersonaBar
steps.expected: The nav_Accounts menu item should be visible in the PersonaBar
steps.actual: The Evoq.Accounts menu item (displayed as 'nav_Accounts') is visible in the PersonaBar iframe. JavaScript verification confirmed hasAccountsElement: true

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify tabs-extensions div container exists in code

steps.expected: The file should contain a div with id='tabs-extensions'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify personabar-extensions CSS class is applied in code

steps.action: Review AccountSettings.html source code for CSS class
steps.expected: The tabs-extensions div should have the 'personabar-extensions' CSS class
steps.actual: AccountSettings.html confirms the div has class="personabar-extensions" applied

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify AccountSettingsController class exists for future implementation

steps.expected: The controller class should exist in the Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings.Components namespace
steps.actual: AccountSettingsController.cs contains an empty AccountSettingsController class in namespace Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings.Components - ready for future implementation

observations: The Evoq.PersonaBar.AccountSettings module is intentionally configured as placeholder infrastructure for future account settings features
The module's .dnn manifest has empty <path> and <controller> elements, which is why clicking the menu item does not open a panel - this is by design
The 'tabs-extensions' div with 'personabar-extensions' class exists in AccountSettings.html but cannot be verified via UI because the panel content does not load
The menu item displays as 'nav_Accounts' (the resource key) instead of a localized name, indicating localization resources may not be fully configured
The menu item uses the 'useravatar' CSS class for its icon as defined in the .dnn manifest
JavaScript verification confirmed the Evoq.Accounts element exists in the PersonaBar iframe DOM
The extension placeholder infrastructure is properly set up for other modules to inject content into the tabs-extensions container in future implementations
